A former UK government Cabinet Minister specialising in public affairs, strategic communication and crisis management, Johnny Mercer is trusted by successive UK Prime Ministers as a holder of strategic relationships and information of national importance, with a reputation for unpicking the most complex political and regulatory deadlocks. Johnny Mercer is an expert communicator and thought leader of sensitive legislation, especially where stakeholders are unaligned and issues are emotive. He's recognised across UK Government as being an expert in crisis communications and management. Delivered one of the most effective political social media campaigns of a generation. He led the transformation of government departments and delivered multi-billion pound projects that reach across the spectrum of public affairs, strategic communication and crisis management. An expert in deflecting politically motivated scrutiny, Johnny Mercer has a reputation for taking a principled stance even under intense political and legal pressure. Embodies legitimacy and trust.
A combat Veteran from Afghanistan, Johnny Mercer left the UK Commandos in order to change the UK Government's approach to his generation of war Veterans. Elected at the first opportunity in a 'no-hoper' seat, Johnny Mercer set about reforming UK Veteran's care in the third sector, statutory provision and commercial environment. Serving two Prime Ministers, Johnny established the UK's first Office for Veterans Affairs and became the UK's first Veterans Minister at the UK Government Cabinet table.
During two periods in Government, Johnny Mercer passed legislation into UK Law which enshrined the rights of the United Kingdoms' Armed Forces Veterans. He designed and operationalised multi-million pound Nation-wide programmes to deliver the UK's first Veteran specific pathways in mental and physical health; homelessness, the criminal justice system and commercial employment opportunities. He drafted the UK's first "Veterans' Bill" before leaving Parliament in July 2024.
